headline: Grant monies awarded to three crisis center agencies
sentences: Funding will support the establishment, maintenance and expansion of programs and projects to provide immediate shelter, supportive services and access to community-based programs for victims of family violence, domestic violence, or dating violence and their dependents.

Included in the latest round of funding was $56,454 for the Crossroads Crisis Center in Allen County, $68,619 for the Auglaize County Crisis Center and $39,767 for the Crisis Care Line in Van Wert County.
The program is the primary federal funding stream dedicated to the support of emergency shelter and related assistance for victims of domestic violence and their children.
Mike DeWine recently announced more than $2.5 million in grants for victim service agencies to support victims of domestic violence during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The funding comes from the Family Violence Prevention and Services Act.
In total, 42 grants were awarded to 40 local agencies in 35 counties.
